content.title: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme-Madhya Pradesh
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
content.details: Launched in the year 2009, the scheme 'Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS)' is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Government of Madhya Pradesh. Under this scheme, financial support is provided to the widows of the state of Sikkim. A widow whose household is below the poverty line is eligible to get the benefits of the pension scheme. The beneficiary receives a monthly pension amount consists of the Central and State governments' share.
benefits: The beneficiary will get a monthly pension of ₹ 600/-.
eligibility: The applicant should be a domicile of the state of Madhya Pradesh.
The applicant should be from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.
The application should be aged between 40 to 79 years.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Step 1: The Application in the prescribed application form in the rural area of his native residence-Gram Panchayat / Janpad Panchayat, Nagar Panchayat / municipal council/ municipal corporation office in an urban area with three photographs, certificate for confirmation of age, Samagra ID and BPL card Or apply online through the nearest Loksewa Kendra. Step 2: Fill in all the mandatory fields of the application form, attach all the (self-attested) mandatory documents, and submit them to the designated receiving authority.

faqs.question: What is the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS)?
faqs.answer: The Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme is a social welfare program initiated by the Government of India to provide financial assistance to widows living below the poverty line.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows belonging to economically vulnerable households, often identified based on their Below Poverty Line (BPL) status, are eligible to receive benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: How does the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme contribute to the welfare of widows?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a monthly pension to widows, helping them meet their basic needs and sustain their livelihoods after the loss of their spouse.

faqs.question: What is the amount of pension provided under the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: The amount of pension varies from state to state and is subject to revision by the respective state governments. Generally, it ranges from ₹600/- per month.

faqs.question: How can widows apply for benefits under the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows can apply for the scheme through designated government offices or online portals by using this link https://socialsecurity.mp.gov.in/Home.aspx.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: 1. Three photos of applicant. 2. Husband's death certificate. 3. B.P.L. card. 4. Certificate to confirm age.

faqs.question: Is there any age restriction for widows to avail benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Widow applicants of 40 to 79 age are eligible to receive pension benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: How to submit offline applications?
faqs.answer: Step 1: The Application in the prescribed application form in the rural area of his native residence-Gram Panchayat / Janpad Panchayat, Nagar Panchayat / municipal council/ municipal corporation office in an urban area with three photographs, certificate for confirmation of age, Samagra ID and BPL card Or apply online through the nearest Loksewa Kendra. Step 2: Fill in all the mandatory fields of the application form, attach all the (self-attested) mandatory documents, and submit them to the designated receiving authority.
